The girl complained of a vomiting sensation after entering the class and went out, an official said. The teacher asked the students to check on her, but the girl had taken the extreme step by then.

347.title: RS gets ultraviolet radiation equipment to contain COVID-19 spread
347.article_body: Ultraviolet C-band radiation equipment has been installed in Rajya Sabha chambers to contain the spread of coronavirus, Chairman M Venkaiah Naidu informed on Monday. Speaking on the first day of the second part of the Budget Session, Naidu added that the recently installed equipment "is very effective in killing the virus." The technology has been developed by CSIR-CSIO.

348.title: Female lawyer attacked with acid in Punjab, escapes unharmed
348.article_body: A female lawyer escaped unharmed after being attacked with acid by two bike-borne men in Punjab's Amritsar. According to reports, the woman was returning home with her brother when the men approached her. One of them sprinkled acid on her but she immediately managed to cover her face with a jacket. Police have registered a case under relevant IPC sections.

349.title: Yellow alert issued for heat wave in Gujarat for next 2 days: IMD
349.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) on Monday issued a 'yellow' alert for Gujarat for the next two days as the heatwave intensifies in India. "The temperature might rise around 1-2° C and a severe heatwave is expected in Saurashtra and Gujarat regions. The temperature in Ahmedabad is expected [to be] around 40-41° C," said Manorama Mohanty, Director, Meteorological Centre Ahmedabad.

350.title: Chennai Corporation using drones to spray larvicide in water bodies
350.article_body: The Greater Chennai Corporation has started using drones to spray mosquito larvicide in order to prevent the breeding of mosquitoes in water bodies. Corporation Commissioner Gagandeep Singh Bedi said two drones are used every day to spray approximately 400 litres of chemicals. He added it was part of the 15 days of anti-larvae chemical spray project started by the corporation.

351.title: Want to take TMC's 'Khela hobe' slogan across India: Shatrughan
351.article_body: Actor and former Union Minister Shatrughan Sinha, who has been announced as TMC's Asansol candidate for Lok Sabha by-election, said on Monday that he wants to take his party's slogan 'Khela hobe' (Game is on) across the country. He further dismissed the Opposition's allegation of him being an "outsider", saying, "I'm no less a Bengali than any other Bengali."

352.title: IMDb changes rating system for 'The Kashmir Files' after 'unusual voting activity'
352.article_body: Film and television review hosting website IMDb has changed its rating system after it "detected unusual voting activity" on 'The Kashmir Files' page. The movie's ratings allegedly dipped after the system change, after which director Vivek Agnihotri said, "This is unusual and unethical." The movie's rating currently stands at 8.3/10, with 2,36,000 votes recorded.

353.title: Face masks of PM in high demand ahead of Holi in UP's Prayagraj
353.article_body: Ahead of Holi, markets in Uttar Pradesh's Prayagraj are witnessing a high demand for PM Narendra Modi's face masks. According to the shopkeepers, BJP's victory in the Assembly elections has given a boost to the demand for PM Modi's masks. "This year Holi will be celebrated with saffron colour," said a shopkeeper in Prayagraj.

354.title: Man rapes 13-yr-old girl repeatedly on pretext of marriage in Guj
354.article_body: Ahmedabad's Ghatlodia Police on Sunday filed a complaint against a 26-year-old man for allegedly raping a 13-year-old girl repeatedly on the pretext of marrying her, reports said. The accused befriended the girl about a year ago and lured her with money and the pretext of marriage, police said. The accused eloped with the girl six months ago, police added.

355.title: Sec 144 in Kalaburagi, Hassan & other K'taka districts ahead of hijab row verdict
355.article_body: Prohibitory orders under CrPC section 144 have been imposed in Karnataka's Bengaluru, Belagavi, Davanagere, Hassan, Kalaburagi and Shivamogga as the High Court will deliver its judgment on hijab ban issue on Tuesday. A ban on gatherings and protests has been imposed in Bengaluru from March 15-March 21. Schools and colleges in Dakshina Kannada and Udupi will remain closed on Tuesday.

356.title: Philippines summons Chinese envoy over navy ship's intrusion
356.article_body: Philippine government summoned Chinese ambassador Huang Xilian on Monday to explain the "illegal intrusion" of a Chinese naval ship into the country's waters. In a statement, Philippine Foreign Ministry said the ship remained in their waters from January 29 to February 1. The government also demanded that Beijing must order its ships to respect Philippine territory and follow international law.

357.title: Channi's greed pulled party down, he's a liability: Cong leader
357.article_body: Following the Congress' defeat in Punjab Assembly elections, former state Congress chief Sunil Jakhar on Monday called Charanjit Singh Channi a "liability" whose "greed pulled the party down". "An asset, are you joking? Thank God he wasn't declared a 'National Treasure' at Congress Working Committee by the 'PBI' lady who proposed him as CM in the first place," he said.

358.title: India's pink, white, red ball form at home in 2022 is outstanding: Sachin
358.article_body: Congratulating India after their pink-ball Test win against Sri Lanka in Bengaluru, Sachin Tendulkar tweeted, "Team India's pink, white...red ball form at home this season has been outstanding." India won red-ball Test against Sri Lanka in Mohali and white-ball (T20I) series against them in Lucknow and Dharamshala. India beat West Indies in white-ball series in Ahmedabad and Kolkata in February.

359.title: Pant becomes first Indian wicketkeeper to win Player of the Series award in Test cricket
359.article_body: Rishabh Pant has become the first Indian wicketkeeper-batter to win Player of the Series award in Test cricket. He was named Player of the Series for scoring 185 runs in the two-match series against Sri Lanka. He had a batting average of 61.66 and strike rate of 120.12 in the series. Pant took five catches and effected three stumpings.

360.title: Farmers to launch protest from March 21 against govt's 'broken promises'
360.article_body: The Samyukt Kisan Morcha on Monday decided to launch a nationwide agitation from March 21 to protest the Centre's 'broken promises' on the issue of forming a panel on MSP. The agitation will be launched in phases and during the second phase from April 11-17, farmers will observe 'MSP guarantee week'. The agitation was earlier suspended on December 9, 2021.

361.title: China's richest billionaires lose over $52 billion in a day as stocks plunge
361.article_body: The combined net worth of China's 78 richest tycoons fell by over $52 billion in a day as Chinese stocks plunged on Monday. Bottled water company Nongfu Spring's Founder and the country's richest person Zhong Shanshan lost the most, with his fortune declining by $5 billion. Tencent's Pony Ma saw his net worth drop by $3.3 billion to $35.2 billion.

362.title: Empire Magazine releases still of Scarlet Witch from Doctor Strange 2
362.article_body: Elizabeth Olsen's new still as Scarlet Witch in the upcoming film 'Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness' has been released by the Empire Magazine. The film will also feature Benedict Cumberbatch, who will play Doctor Strange in the film. 'Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness', directed by Sam Raimi, is expected to have cameos by MCU characters.

363.title: I rejoined politics because of Mamata Banerjee: TMC's Babul Supriyo
363.article_body: Trinamool Congress (TMC) leader Babul Supriyo said on Monday that he rejoined politics because party supremo and West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee asked him to work for the state. Supriyo's remark came after the TMC declared him as its candidate in the Assembly by-election from Ballygunge seat. Supriyo had resigned as Union Minister and BJP's MP from Asansol in 2021.

364.title: Kyiv Mayor in selfie video shows damage caused by Russian forces in Ukraine
364.article_body: In a selfie video, Kyiv’s Mayor Vitali Klitschko showed the damage caused in Ukraine amid the ongoing war with Russia. In the clip, Klitschko said, “That's what Russians' war against civilians looks like. Destroyed buildings, destroyed infrastructure...Lives are getting lost." Sharing the video, he also wrote, "Putin's dream of creating a Greater Russia is my country's nightmare."

365.title: I knew only two words in English when I first arrived in Bombay: Anil Agarwal
365.article_body: Anil Agarwal, the 68-year-old billionaire Executive Chairman of Vedanta Resources, tweeted, "When I first arrived in Bombay, I knew only two words in English, 'yes' and 'no'." He said, "I held on to my dreams of making it big." He added, "I came to know a cable company was on the brink of bankruptcy...I started dreaming about acquiring that company."

366.title: 700 primary schools in Gujarat managed by 1 teacher each, says govt
366.article_body: As many as 700 government primary schools in Gujarat are run by a single teacher each, who teaches from classes 1 to 8, said the state government's data tabled in the Gujarat Legislature on Monday. Kutch has 100 such schools with one teacher each. Mahisagar has 74 such schools and Tapi has 59 schools, as per the data.

367.title: 'No Time To Die' film editors criticise Oscars for broadcast cuts
367.article_body: 'No Time To Die' editors Tom Cross and Elliot Graham, who won Best Editing at BAFTA Awards 2022, have criticised the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences for cutting eight categories, including Best Film Editing, from the live telecast plans. "All of those nominees...deserve to stand up...same way everyone else does," Cross stated. Graham added, "It's f****d up."

368.title: ED attached wrong properties of ex-Amrapali Director: Auditor to SC
368.article_body: Forensic auditor Pawan Agarwala told the Supreme Court that the Enforcement Directorate has attached wrong properties of Amrapali Group's ex-Director Prem Mishra. These properties need to be detached and auctioned off to generate funds for stalled projects' construction, Agarwala said. SC had directed ED to investigate alleged money laundering by realtors, including Amrapali Group.

369.title: HC to deliver judgment on hijab ban tomorrow, section 144 imposed in B'luru
369.article_body: The Karnataka HC will deliver its judgment on the hijab ban issue on Tuesday and section 144 was imposed in Bengaluru from March 15-March 21, banning all types of gatherings and protests. The protests in the state began in January after some Muslim girl students in the Udupi district alleged that they were banned from attending classes while wearing hijab.

370.title: Himanshu continues shooting for 'Aggar Tum Na Hote' despite injury
370.article_body: Himanshu Soni, who is the lead actor in 'Aggar Tum Na Hote', has continued shooting for the serial despite suffering a back injury on the set. "I have in fact been advised bed rest for two months, but as the main character...I know how important it is for me to be present for each scene," he added.

371.title: Made mistakes in past, but learning every day: Pant on Player of Series win
371.article_body:
On being asked which aspect of his game (batting or wicketkeeping) satisfies him more, India wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant said, "Both of them...because, as a cricketer, you want to evolve." He added, "I've made a few mistakes in the past, but I'm learning each and every day."
Pant was adjudged 'Player of the Series' in India-Sri Lanka two-match Test series.

372.title: Irish Aviation Authority revokes permits of Russian-operated planes
372.article_body: Irish Aviation Authority on Monday revoked certificates of airworthiness for all Russian-operated planes registered in the country amid the war between Russia and Ukraine. Reportedly, no plane is allowed to fly without the certificate. This comes after Bermuda Civil Aviation Authority also suspended certification of all Russian-operated planes on March 12 amid international sanctions over the war.

373.title: Moscow mayor ends requirement to use protective masks from March 15
373.article_body: Moscow mayor Sergei Sobyanin on Monday ended the requirement to use protective masks in public starting Tuesday, March 15. Citing improving COVID-19 situation in the Russian capital, Sobyanin added companies won't have to ensure anti-COVID-19 measures such as temperature checks and social distancing. Meanwhile the country reported 41,055 cases in last 24 hours with Moscow logging 957 infections.

374.title: 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' lovely film, Alia blessed with talent: Karthi
374.article_body: Tamil actor Karthi on Monday took to Twitter to appreciate Sanjay Leela Bhansali's 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' calling it a lovely film. He tweeted that actress Alia Bhatt is blessed with great talent, writing, "She erupts, melts and shines without losing the innocence." Karthi further wrote that the film is opulent and rich with aesthetics, adding that it is very special.

375.title: UK will continue supplying weapons to Ukraine: PM's spokesman
375.article_body: The UK will continue providing weapons to Ukraine, PM Boris Johnson's spokesman said on Monday. "We will absolutely carry on providing this...lethal capability to the Ukrainian government...We know it has been helpful," he added. The comments came after Russia launched missile strikes at a Ukrainian military base near Poland's border on Sunday, which the UK has termed "deeply concerning".

376.title: I wanted to show truth to whole world: Vivek on 'The Kashmir Files'
376.article_body: 'The Kashmir Files' director Vivek Agnihotri has said that he made the film because he wanted to show the truth to the whole world. "I wanted to make a sensitive film that has universal resonance," the filmmaker added. He further said he was inspired by Hollywood to make films that praise the country and present its greatness to the world.

377.title: He can send Putin to Jupiter: Ukraine Vice PM on 'Musk-Putin fight' tweet
377.article_body: Ukraine's Vice PM Mykhailo Fedorov while reacting to Tesla CEO Elon Musk's tweet calling for single combat with Russian President Vladimir Putin, wrote that the former can send Putin to Jupiter. Earlier today, the world's richest man Musk tweeted, "I hereby challenge Vladimir Putin to single combat...Stakes are Ukraine." Musk also tweeted to ask if Putin agreed to the fight.

378.title: AAP to contest 2023 panchayat polls in Bengal: State party in charge
378.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) will contest the 2023 panchayat elections in West Bengal, state party in charge Sanjoy Basu confirmed on Monday. Basu added that the party has commenced its campaign in the state. Notably, AAP held a victory rally in Kolkata on Sunday to celebrate its win in the recently-concluded Punjab Assembly elections.

379.title: International kabaddi player Sandeep Nangal shot dead during tournament in Punjab
379.article_body: International kabaddi player Sandeep Nangal was shot dead on Monday by unidentified assailants during a kabaddi tournament in Malian village in Punjab's Jalandhar, police said. Around eight to 10 bullets were fired at him as per the police. As per reports, the bullets hit his head and chest.

380.title: Shreyas Iyer and Amelia Kerr named ICC Players of the Month for February
380.article_body: ICC today announced that India batter Shreyas Iyer and New Zealand Women all-rounder Amelia Kerr were voted ICC Players of the Month in men's and women's category respectively for February 2022. In February, Iyer had won Player of the Series award for scoring three unbeaten T20I fifties against Sri Lanka. Kerr had finished top-run scorer in ODI series against India.

381.title: Air India has 2,657 pending cases in Indian and international courts: Govt
381.article_body: Air India has 2,657 cases pending against it in Indian and international courts, VK Singh, the Minister of State for Civil Aviation, informed Rajya Sabha on Monday. These cases related to issues such as employee service matters, consumer complaints and commercial matters. "These cases are against Air India as a legal entity and will remain with Air India," Singh said.

382.title: AI & Robotics Tech Park launched at IISc B'luru with ₹230 cr seed fund
382.article_body: An Artificial Intelligence and Robotics Technology Park (ARTPARK) has been launched at the Indian Institute of Science (IISc) in Bengaluru with a seed capital of ₹230 crore from the Centre and the Karnataka government. "ARTPARK has been set up to effectively use technology, specifically AI and robotics, for the country's betterment," Karnataka's Minister for IT-BT, CN Ashwathnarayan, said.

383.title: Video captures moment when missile strikes & explodes in Ukraine street
383.article_body: A video has surfaced online that showed how a missile exploded in the middle of a street in Ukraine while a man escaped seconds before its explosion. In the clip, the man can be seen walking along the street when the missile strikes through the air and explodes. It reportedly destroyed a tram and hit part of a residential building.

384.title: Over 2,500 Mariupol civilians killed since Russia invaded: Ukraine
384.article_body: Over 2,500 civilians were killed in Mariupol since Russia invaded Ukraine on February 24, said Alexey Arestovich, advisor to Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Monday. One of the worst-hit cities, Mariupol saw destruction of several of its civilian facilities including a children's hospital since the war began. Meanwhile, UN said over 2.8 million Ukrainians have fled their homeland so far.

385.title: Berlin warns refugees from Ukraine about human trafficking danger
385.article_body: Germany's Berlin has warned refugees from Ukraine against accepting monetary or accommodation offers at city's main train station amid concerns of human trafficking. "There may be criminals on the move at Berlin central station who want to profit from...situation of war refugees," Berlin government said. Nearly 1,47,000 Ukrainian refugees have registered in Germany so far, German government said.

386.title: Hope to maintain consistency ahead: Shreyas on his 92, 67 in 2nd Test
386.article_body: After winning 'Player of the Match' award in India's 238-run win against Sri Lanka in second Test, India batter Shreyas Iyer said he hopes he can maintain the consistency in future. Shreyas hit 92 and 67, top-scoring for India in both the innings. Earlier, Shreyas was adjudged 'Player of the Series' in India's 3-0 T20I series win against Sri Lanka.

387.title: UN launches final talks on global biodiversity framework in Geneva
387.article_body: UN on Monday launched its final talks to strike a deal on the global biodiversity framework in Geneva, Switzerland. Representatives from 164 countries will discuss over an international pact to safeguard nature and protect vulnerable species with a target of conserving 30% of countries' territory by 2030. The talks are slated to be held from March 14 to 29.

388.title: How does the WTC points table read after India's victory against Sri Lanka?
388.article_body: India jumped to fourth spot on World Test Championship (WTC) points table after completing a 2-0 series whitewash against Sri Lanka. India are fourth with 58.33% of points won, while Sri Lanka are fifth with 50% of points won. England are last on the table with 11.67% of points won, while Australia are on top with 77.77% of points won.

389.title: It was surprising, I wasn't asked to audition: Shabana Azmi on 'Halo'
389.article_body: Veteran actress Shabana Azmi, who will be seen in upcoming series 'Halo', said that the role was surprising for her as she wasn't asked to audition. She added that her agent was in talks with the producers without letting her know. "It was only after I got confirmed that I had my first facetime call with the director," Shabana said.

390.title: Shreyas knew he was stepping into big shoes of Rahane, Pujara: Rohit
390.article_body: Talking about Shreyas Iyer, who top-scored for India with 92 and 67 in Day-Night Test against Sri Lanka, India captain Rohit Sharma said Shreyas knew he was stepping into "big shoes" of Ajinkya Rahane and Cheteshwar Pujara. "He has everything that he requires," he added. The 27-year-old batter was adjudged 'Player of the Match' in India's 238-run win in Bengaluru.

391.title: 15 dead in Bihar after consuming spurious alcohol
391.article_body: A total of 15 people were killed in Bihar after they drank spurious alcohol, police said. Bhagalpur and Gopalganj districts reported six and nine deaths respectively while two more people have been admitted to hospitals in Gorakhpur and Bhagalpur. Police has arrested five people from Bhagalpur for supplying illicit liquor during a marriage party.

392.title: This marks another year of your brilliance: Ajay on Rohit's birthday
392.article_body: Actor Ajay Devgn took to Twitter and wished filmmaker Rohit Shetty on his birthday. "Our collaborations have always left me thrilled, ROFL-ing and pumped for more! This marks another year of your brilliance, hard work and creativity. Happy birthday, my friend," Ajay wrote. The duo has worked together in several projects like the 'Golmaal' series, 'Zameen' and 'Singham'.

393.title: Shah Rukh's old video on 'futility of war' goes viral amid Russia-Ukraine war
393.article_body: Amid the Russian invasion of Ukraine, an old video where Bollywood actor Shah Rukh Khan is talking about the "futility of war", has gone viral online. "Only the dead have seen the end of war. Nobody knows when a war's going to end. It only ends for the guys who've died...War isn't an alternative to peace, goodness," said Shah Rukh.

394.title: 'Musk-Putin's fight will be over in 10 secs' says Twitter user; Musk says 'pretty much'
394.article_body: Elon Musk responded "pretty much" to a Twitter user who claimed Musk and Russian President Vladimir Putin's "fight" would be over in 10 seconds. The user said, "It'd just depend on how much damage Elon would want to do (and) how fast. Nothing else...Elon is also 19 years younger." This comes after Musk challenged Putin to single combat for Ukraine.

395.title: Video captures moment when missile strikes & explodes in Ukraine street
395.article_body: CCTV footage captured the moment when a missile hit a street in Ukraine’s Kyiv. In the clip, a person can be seen walking along the street when a missile strikes through the air, smashes on the road leading to an explosion. The explosion reportedly destroyed a tram and hit part of a residential building.

396.title: I'm not in a rush to appear in B'wood films, I can wait: Pooja Hedge
396.article_body: Actress Pooja Hegde in an interview said that she is not in a rush to appear in Bollywood films and doesn't fear losing out on visibility. "No, I can wait...It is a blessing that the audience has accepted me in every region," the actress added. Pooja further said that people earlier only complimented her screen presence and beauty.

397.title: Greek PM Kyriakos Mitsotakis tests positive for COVID-19
397.article_body: Greek Prime Minister Kyriakos Mitsotakis on Monday said he tested positive for COVID-19 through a video message on Instagram. "I tested positive this morning and therefore will isolate at home and work from there," stated Mitsotakis. This comes after Mitsotakis held talks over the war in Ukraine with Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdoğan in Istanbul on Sunday.

398.title: Janhvi will be brilliant in 'Mili', can't wait to watch her: Anna
398.article_body: Malayalam actress Anna Ben said actress Janhvi Kapoor will be brilliant in the film 'Mili' and added she can't wait to watch her in it. 'Mili' is a Hindi remake of Anna's 2019 Malayalam film 'Helen'. "I'm...excited for Mili because Mathukutty (Xavier) has directed the film in Hindi as well," she stated. The film stars Manoj Pahwa and Sunny Kaushal.

399.title: How to lose elections can be learned from Congress: Anurag Thakur
399.article_body: Union Minister Anurag Thakur while referring to Congress' defeat in the recently-concluded state Assembly elections said that "how to lose elections" should be learned from the party. He said, "There was no anti-incumbency in any of the states" adding that the clean image and good work of the Chief Ministers also led to their victory.

400.title: To me, it's all life: Russian influencer's crying video after Instagram ban goes viral
400.article_body: After Russia banned Instagram, a video of a crying Russian Instagram influencer is being widely shared on social media. In the clip, she said, "Do you think that for me, as an Instagram influencer, this is [a] source of income? To me, it’s [Instagram] just all life, it’s the soul. It’s the one with which I wake up, fall asleep."
